text: The Division of Aston is an Australian Electoral Division in Victoria. It was created in 1984 and is named for Tilly Aston. Aston was a blind writer and teacher who helped setup the Library of the Victorian Association of Braille Writers in 1894. Aston is in the eastern suburbs of Melbourne, including Rowville, Scoresby, Knoxfield, Vermont and Wantirna. ==Members== Member Party Term John Saunderson Labor 1984–1990 Peter Nugent Liberal 1990–2001 Chris Pearce Liberal 2001–2010 Alan Tudge Liberal 2010–present In 2013, Alan Tudge was made the Parliamentary Secretary to the Prime Minister, Tony Abbott. ==Election results== ==References== ==Other websites== * Division of Aston - Australian Electoral Commission * Alan Tudge's website Category:Electoral divisions of Victoria, Australia Category:1984 establishments in Australia
title: Division of Aston
